item.description:
Fall 2012, great for Fall Foliage. Amherst, ma - Northampton, ma. (11 mls - one way)

The Norwottock Rail Trail is an 11 mile path linking Northampton, Hadley, and Amherst along the former Boston & Main Railroad right-of-way. The path's level terrain provides safe passage for pedestrians, wheelchairs, joggers, skaters, bicyclists, and cross-country skier of all ages and abilities. Motorized vehicles and horses are prohibited. Both ends of the path offer free parking for trail users – Elwell State Park on Damon Road in Northampton and Station Road in South Amherst. Public restrooms are available at the parking area at Elwell

http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/trails/nwrt_map.gif

http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/central/nwrt.htm

DIRECTIONS:

FROM THE WEST:

1. Head east on I-90 E

2. Take exit 4 for I-91 toward Holyoke/Springfield - 0.6 mi

3. Keep left at the fork, follow signs for I-91 and merge onto I-91 N - 13.8 mi

4. Take exit 19 toward Northampton - 0.2 mi

5. Go straight through traffic light - Park will be on the right 358 ft

 

FROM THE EAST:

1. Head west on I-90 W

2. Take exit 4 for I-91toward Springfield/Holyoke - 0.2 mi

3. Keep left at the fork, follow signs for I-91 and merge onto I-91 N - 13.8 mi

4. Take exit 19 toward Northampton - 0.2 mi

5. Go straight through traffic light - Park will be on the right - 358 ft

 

FROM THE NORTH:

1. Take I-91 S

2. Take exit 20 to merge onto N King St- 0.4 mi

3. Turn left at Damon Rd - Park will be on the left - 0.9 mi

 

FROM THE SOUTH:

1. Take I-91 N

2. Take exit 19 for MA-9 toward Northampton - 0.2 mi

3. Go straight through traffic light - Park will be on the right 358 ft
item.name: Norwottuck Rail Trail, Central Mass.
